message:
Blocking the rendering of the content due to web fonts is disrespectful, annoying and unnecessary. Show content in fallback font first, load Web fonts later. And it’s not difficult to achieve either. Store fonts in localStorage or just use WebFontLoader: https://github.com/typekit/webfontloader. One-time-font-switch is OK.

There’s nothing more annoying than knowing that the content is already available but blocked due to heavy Web fonts.﻿
story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: typekit/webfontloader
caption: github.com
description: webfontloader - Web Font Loader gives you added control when using linked fonts via @font-face.

data.message:
Honestly I think this issue is taking way more interest/effort than it should. There is even a proposal for the CSSWG to unify font loading order, timeout time ... etc. More information here: https://github.com/KenjiBaheux/css-font-rendering
I think it is over complicating a silly issue. It's just a three seconds gap (except for Safari I think that keeps blocking till network timeout)]

After a second thought, this might actually be good for eliminating page rendering block (not talking about FOUSC, I am talking about when the whole rendering of the page is blocked because it is trying to access Google fonts for example ...)
I will give it a try
